briefdescription.para: Time interval for structural plasticity update (creation/deletion of synapses).
Indicates whether the Structrual Plasticity functionality is On (True) of Off (False).
GrowthCurve factories, indexed by growthcurvedict_ elements.
Dictionary for growth rules.
Prepare manager for operation.

detaileddescription.para: After this method has completed, the manager should be completely initialized and "ready for action".

simplesect.para: Initialization of any given manager may depend on other managers having been initialized before. KernelManager::initialize() is responsible for calling the initialization routines on the specific managers in correct order.

briefdescription.para: Take down manager after operation.

detaileddescription.para: After this method has completed, all dynamic data structures created by the manager shall be deallocated and containers emptied. Plain variables need not be reset.

simplesect.para: Finalization of any given manager may depend on other managers not having been finalized yet. KernelManager::finalize() is responsible for calling the initialization routines on the specific managers in correct order, i.e., the opposite order of initialize() calls.

briefdescription.para: Set status of synaptic plasticity variables: synaptic update interval, synapses and synaptic elements.

parameterdescription.para: Dictionary containing the values to be set

briefdescription.para: Create a new Growth Curve object using the GrowthCurve Factory.

parameterdescription.para: which defines the type of NC to be created

simplesect.para: a new Growth Curve object of the type indicated by name

briefdescription.para: Add a growth curve for MSP.
Disconnect two collections of nodes.

detaileddescription.para: Obtains the right connection builder and performs a synapse deletion according to the specified connection specs.
The connection is established on the thread/process that owns the target node.

parameterdescription.para: Node collection of the source Nodes.
Node collection of the target Nodes.
disconnection specs. For now only all to all and one to one rules are implemented.

memberdef.argsstring: (const index snode_id, Node *target, thread target_thread, const index syn_id)
memberdef.name: disconnect

briefdescription.para: Disconnect two nodes.

detaileddescription.para: Deletes synapses between a source and a target.
The source node is defined by its global ID. The target node is defined by the node. The connection is established on the thread/process that owns the target node.

parameterdescription.para: node ID of the sending Node.
Thread that hosts the target node.

briefdescription.para: Handles the general dynamic creation and deletion of synapses when structural plasticity is enabled.

detaileddescription.para:
Retrieves the number of available synaptic elements to create new synapses. Retrieves the number of deleted synaptic elements to delete already created synapses.
sp_builder
The structural plasticity connection builder to use

briefdescription.para: Enable structural plasticity.
Disable structural plasticity.
Returns the minimum delay of all SP builders.

detaileddescription.para: This influences the min_delay of the kernel, as the connections are build during the simulation. Hence, the ConnectionManager::min_delay() methods have to respect this delay as well.

briefdescription.para: Returns the maximum delay of all SP builders.

detaileddescription.para: This influences the max_delay of the kernel, as the connections are build during the simulation. Hence, the ConnectionManager::max_delay() methods have to respect this delay as well.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::vector< index > &pre_vacant_id, std::vector< int > &pre_vacant_n, std::vector< index > &post_vacant_id, std::vector< int > &post_vacant_n, SPBuilder *sp_conn_builder)
memberdef.name: create_synapses

briefdescription.para: Dynamic creation of synapses.

parameterdescription.para: number of available synaptic elements in the pre node
number of available synaptic elements in the post node
structural plasticity connection builder to use

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< index > &pre_deleted_id, std::vector< int > &pre_deleted_n, const index synapse_model, const std::string &se_pre_name, const std::string &se_post_name)
memberdef.name: delete_synapses_from_pre

briefdescription.para: Deletion of synapses due to the loss of a pre synaptic element.

detaileddescription.para:
The corresponding pre synaptic element will still remain available for a new connection on the following updates in connectivity
pre_deleted_id
Id of the node with the deleted pre synaptic element
pre_deleted_n
number of deleted pre synaptic elements
synapse_model
model name
se_pre_name
pre synaptic element name
se_post_name
postsynaptic element name

memberdef.argsstring: (std::vector< index > &post_deleted_id, std::vector< int > &post_deleted_n, index synapse_model, std::string se_pre_name, std::string se_post_name)
memberdef.name: delete_synapses_from_post

briefdescription.para: Deletion of synapses due to the loss of a postsynaptic element.

detaileddescription.para:
The corresponding pre synaptic element will still remain available for a new connection on the following updates in connectivity
post_deleted_id
Id of the node with the deleted postsynaptic element
post_deleted_n
number of deleted postsynaptic elements
synapse_model
model name
se_pre_name
pre synaptic element name
se_post_name
postsynaptic element name

memberdef.argsstring: (index source, index target, long syn_id, std::string se_pre_name, std::string se_post_name)
memberdef.name: delete_synapse

briefdescription.para: Handles the deletion of synapses between source and target nodes.

detaileddescription.para:
The deletion is defined by the pre and postsynaptic elements and the synapse type. Updates the number of connected synaptic elements in the source and target.
snode_id
source id
tnode_id
target id
syn_id
synapse type
se_pre_name
name of the pre synaptic element
se_post_name
name of the postsynaptic element

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string se_name, std::vector< index > &se_vacant_id, std::vector< int > &se_vacant_n, std::vector< index > &se_deleted_id, std::vector< int > &se_deleted_n)
memberdef.name: get_synaptic_elements

briefdescription.para: The SPManager class is in charge of managing the dynamic creation and deletion of synapses in the simulation when structural plasticity is enabled.

detaileddescription.para: Otherwise it behaves as the normal ConnectionManager.
